simulated_ratings.title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2 (2011)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A grim, propulsive finale whose glossy heroics kept me a bit detached.

simulated_ratings.title: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Moody and hormonal, but the myth-housekeeping and teen mush kept me at arm’s length.

simulated_ratings.title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1 (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: I liked the windswept dread, but it still feels like stalling for the real ending.

simulated_ratings.title: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Rebellion beats are rousing enough, yet the franchise machinery hums louder than the emotion.

simulated_ratings.title: Star Wars: Episode VII - The Force Awakens (2015)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A slick nostalgia machine that entertains while smothering any real strangeness.

simulated_ratings.title: Tom Segura: Mostly Stories (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Amused in patches, but the bawdy bitterness numbs more than it builds.

simulated_ratings.title: The Accursed (2022)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Serviceable cabin dread with demonic garnish that never crawled under my skin.

simulated_ratings.title: Monsters University (2013)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Peppy and polished, but the prequel sheen sands off the weirder charm I crave.

simulated_ratings.title: Don't Hug Me I'm Scared 4 (2015)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Delightfully deranged edu-terror—glitchy, grim, and right up my surreal alley.

simulated_ratings.title: ARQ (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Tight, loopy paranoia with just enough sting even if the ideas aren’t revelatory.

simulated_ratings.title: South Solitary (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Austere, wind-bitten loneliness rendered with gentle, prickly warmth.

simulated_ratings.title: Toy Story 3 (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A clever, tender caper whose engineered tears still mostly worked on me.

simulated_ratings.title: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (2005)

simulated_ratings.title: Star Trek V: The Final Frontier (1989)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A ramshackle cosmic quest where campy curiosities outshine coherence.

simulated_ratings.title: Chronicle (2012)

simulated_ratings.title: Twin Town (1997)

simulated_ratings.title: The Lego Movie 2: The Second Part (2019)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A meta sugar rush that’s cute but thinner and less sly this time.

simulated_ratings.title: Battle for the Planet of the Apes (1973)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A shaggy, end-of-series fable with scrappy charm more than impact.

simulated_ratings.title: Incredibles 2 (2018)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Sleek, zippy set pieces and domestic jitters—fun, if emotionally light.

simulated_ratings.title: Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania (2023)
simulated_ratings.feeling: CGI treacle and quippy noise—spectacle without the sting or strangeness I need.

simulated_ratings.title: Home Alone 2: Lost in New York (1992)

simulated_ratings.title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (2004)

simulated_ratings.title: Back to the Future Part II (1989)
